name: CreatePowerpack
description:
Creates a new powerpack in Datadog.

Use this tool to initiate a powerpack creation in Datadog when managing monitoring configurations is required.

parameters.name: powerpack_request_body
parameters.description: JSON object containing powerpack details like attributes, name, tags, template variables, relationships, etc.

show_title.description: Boolean indicating whether powerpack group title should be visible or not.

type.description: Type of widget, must be group.

height.description: The height of the widget. Should be a non-negative integer.

width.description: The width of the widget. Should be a non-negative integer.

x.description: The position of the widget on the x (horizontal) axis. Should be a non-negative integer.

y.description: The position of the widget on the y (vertical) axis. Should be a non-negative integer.

height.description: The height of the widget. Should be a non-negative integer.

width.description: The width of the widget. Should be a non-negative integer.

x.description: The position of the widget on the x (horizontal) axis. Should be a non-negative integer.

y.description: The position of the widget on the y (vertical) axis. Should be a non-negative integer.

live_span.description: The available timeframes depend on the widget you are using.

tags.description: List of tags to identify this powerpack.

available_values.description: The list of values that the template variable drop-down is limited to.

defaults.description: One or many template variable default values within the saved view, which are unioned together using `OR` if more than one is specified.

prefix.description: The tag prefix associated with the variable. Only tags with this prefix appear in the variable drop-down.

template_variables.description: List of template variables for this powerpack.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the user.

type.description: Type of widget, must be powerpack.
